00073 EQUIPMENT equipment[] = {
00074     {"Crate ",                 /* equipment name */
00075      {1000, TRIGGER_ALL,       /* event ID, trigger mask */
00076       "BUF",                      /* event buffer */
00077       EQ_POLLED | EQ_EB,        /* equipment type */
00078       LAM_SOURCE(0, 0xFFFFFF),  /* event source crate 0, all stations */
00079       "MIDAS",                  /* format */
00080       TRUE,                     /* enabled */
00081       RO_RUNNING,               /* read only when running */
00082       500,                      /* poll for 500ms */
00083       0,                        /* stop run after this event limit */
00084       0,                        /* number of sub events */
00085       0,                        /* don't log history */
00086       "", "", ""},
00087      read_trigger_event,        /* readout routine */

00144  * frontend_early_init:  Called before most MIDAS subsystems are initialized,
00145  *                       so we can set the name (etc.) of the frontend here.
00146  */
00147 INT frontend_early_init()
00148 {
00149   // Determine our crate ID by comparing against a list of hostnames
00150   printf("Enter\n");
00151 #if 0
00152   //char *hostnames[] = {"musun1.phys.washington.edu"};

00159 
00160   gethostname(my_hostname, sizeof(my_hostname));
00161 printf("nnnnnnnn \n");

00164     if(!strcmp(my_hostname, hostnames[i])) {
00165       crate_number = crate_numbers[i];
00166       has_periodic = crate_has_periodic[i];
00167     }
00168   }
00169 #endif
00170 
00171         crate_number = 9;
00172         BOOL has_periodic = FALSE;
00173   if(crate_number > 0) {
00174     frontend_name = new char[32];
00175     strcpy(frontend_name, "Crate ");
00176 printf("pppppppppp \n");
00177 #if 0
00178     sprintf(equipment[0].name, "Crate %d", crate_number);
00179     sprintf(equipment[0].info.buffer, "BUF%d", crate_number);
00180     equipment[0].info.event_id = 1000 + crate_number;
00181 #endif
00182     frontend_index = crate_number;

00184     if(has_periodic) {
00185       sprintf(equipment[1].name, "Periodic %d", crate_number);

00189     }
00190   }

00195 /* ********************************************************************* */
00196 /*
00197  * frontend_init:  When the frontend program is started. This routine
00198  *                 should initialize the hardware.
00199  */
00200 INT frontend_init()
00201 {
00202   INT run_state = odb_get_int("/Runinfo/State");
00203   if (run_state != STATE_STOPPED) {
00204     cm_msg(MERROR, "Crate",
00205             "Run must be stopped before starting crate program.");
00206     return FE_ERR_HW;
00207   }
00208 
00209   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00210     if((*trigger_modules[i]).init != NULL) {
00211       int status = (*trigger_modules[i]).init();
00212       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00213         return status;
00214       }
00215     }
00216   }
00217 
00218   for(int i = 0; i < num_periodic_modules; i++) {
00219     if((*periodic_modules[i]).init != NULL) {
00220       int status = (*periodic_modules[i]).init();
00221       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00222         return status;
00223       }
00224     }
00225   }
00226 
00227   // bump our priority 
00228   
00229   if(setpriority(PRIO_PROCESS, 0, -2)) {
00230     perror("setpriority");
00231   }
00232  printf("finit....\n");
00233   return SUCCESS;
00234 }

00236 /* ********************************************************************* */
00237 /*
00238  * frontend_exit:  When the frontend program is shut down. Can be used
00239  *                 to release any locked resources like memory, commu-
00240  *                 nications ports etc.
00241  */
00242 INT frontend_exit()
00243 {
00244   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00245     if((*trigger_modules[i]).exit != NULL) {
00246       (*trigger_modules[i]).exit();
00247     }
00248   }
00249 
00250   for(int i = 0; i < num_periodic_modules; i++) {
00251     if((*periodic_modules[i]).exit != NULL) {
00252       (*periodic_modules[i]).exit();
00253     }
00254   }
00255 
00256   return SUCCESS;
00257 }

00260  * pre_begin_of_run:   Called before a new run is started. 
00261  */
00262 INT pre_begin_of_run(INT run_number, char *error)
00263 {
00264   diag_print(1, "*** Before begin of run %d ***\n", run_number);
00265 
00266   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00267     if((*trigger_modules[i]).pre_bor != NULL) {
00268       int status = (*trigger_modules[i]).pre_bor();
00269       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00270         return status;
00271       }
00272     }
00273   }
00274 
00275   for(int i = 0; i < num_periodic_modules; i++) {
00276     if((*periodic_modules[i]).pre_bor != NULL) {
00277       int status = (*periodic_modules[i]).pre_bor();
00278       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00279         return status;
00280       }
00281     }
00282   }
00283 
00284 
00285   return SUCCESS;
00286 }

00288 /* ********************************************************************* */
00289 /*
00290  * begin_of_run:   When a new run is started. Clear scalers, open
00291  *                 rungates, etc.
00292  */
00293 INT begin_of_run(INT run_number, char *error)
00294 {
00295   diag_print(1, "*** Begin of run %d ***\n", run_number);
00296 
00297   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00298     if((*trigger_modules[i]).bor != NULL) {
00299       int status = (*trigger_modules[i]).bor();
00300       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00301         return status;
00302       }
00303     }
00304   }
00305 
00306   for(int i = 0; i < num_periodic_modules; i++) {
00307     if((*periodic_modules[i]).bor != NULL) {
00308       int status = (*periodic_modules[i]).bor();
00309       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00310         return status;
00311       }
00312     }
00313   }
00314 
00315   cycle_active = 0;
00316   event_avail = false;
00317   between_runs = false;
00318 
00319   return SUCCESS;
00320 }
00321 
00322 /* ********************************************************************* */
00323 /*
00324  * end_of_run:     Called on a request to stop a run. Can send
00325  *                 end-of-run event and close run gates.
00326  */
00327 INT end_of_run(INT run_number, char *error)
00328 {
00329   diag_print(1, "*** End of run %d ***\n", run_number);
00330 
00331   between_runs = true;
00332 
00333   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00334     if((*trigger_modules[i]).eor != NULL) {
00335       int status = (*trigger_modules[i]).eor();
00336       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00337         return status;
00338       }
00339     }
00340   }
00341 
00342   for(int i = 0; i < num_periodic_modules; i++) {
00343     if((*periodic_modules[i]).eor != NULL) {
00344       int status = (*periodic_modules[i]).eor();
00345       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00346         return status;
00347       }
00348     }
00349   }
00350 
00351 
00352   return SUCCESS;
00353 }

00373 /* ********************************************************************* */
00374 /*
00375  * start_cycle
00376  */
00377 void start_cycle()
00378 {
00379   struct timeval restart_time;
00380   gettimeofday(&restart_time, NULL);
00381 
00382   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00383     if((*trigger_modules[i]).start_cycle != NULL) {
00384       (*trigger_modules[i]).start_cycle();
00385     }
00386   }
00387 
00388   diag_print(2, "Waited %f microseconds for restart.\n", 
00389     (restart_time.tv_sec-readout_finished_time.tv_sec)*1e6 +
00390       (restart_time.tv_usec-readout_finished_time.tv_usec));
00391 
00392   cycle_active = 1;
00393 }
00394 
00395 /* ********************************************************************* */
00396 /*
00397  * consider_start
00398  */
00399 INT consider_start()
00400 {
00401     for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00402       if((*trigger_modules[i]).poll_dead != NULL) {
00403         int status = (*trigger_modules[i]).poll_dead();
00404 
00405         if(status == FE_NEED_START && !event_avail) {
00406           start_cycle();
00407         } else if(status != SUCCESS) {
00408           return status;
00409         }
00410       }
00411     }
00412 
00413 }
00414 
00415 /* ********************************************************************* */
00416 /*
00417  * stop_cycle
00418  */
00419 void stop_cycle()
00420 {
00421   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00422     if((*trigger_modules[i]).stop_cycle != NULL) {
00423       (*trigger_modules[i]).stop_cycle();
00424     }
00425   }
00426 }

00428 /* ********************************************************************* */
00429 /* 
00430  * If frontend_call_loop is true, this routine gets called when
00431  * the frontend is idle or once between every event 
00432  */ 
00433 INT frontend_loop()
00434 {
00435   // If we're going to be pre-empted, get it over with during livetime
00436   // rather than deadtime.
00437   if (cycle_active || run_state != STATE_RUNNING || between_runs == TRUE) { 
00438     dm_area_flush();
00439     sched_yield();
00440   }
00441 
00442   // Exit immediately if no run in progress
00443   if (run_state != STATE_RUNNING || between_runs == TRUE) {
00444     // make sure we keep flushing out old data, even between runs.
00445     dm_area_flush();
00446     sched_yield();
00447     return SUCCESS;
00448   }
00449 
00450   // Call appropriate poll functions, depending on whether we're live or dead
00451   if (cycle_active) { 
00452 
00453     for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00454       if((*trigger_modules[i]).poll_live != NULL) {
00455 
00456         // There are conditions that can lead to changes in run state between
00457         // modules...
00458         if (run_state != STATE_RUNNING || between_runs == TRUE) {
00459           return SUCCESS;
00460         }
00461         int status = (*trigger_modules[i]).poll_live();
00462 
00463         if(status == FE_END_BLOCK) {
00464           cycle_active = 0;
00465           event_avail = true;
00466         } else if(status == FE_NEED_STOP) {
00467           stop_cycle(); 
00468         } else if(status != SUCCESS) {
00469           return status;
00470         }
00471       }
00472     }
00473   } else {
00474     consider_start();
00475   }
00476 
00477   return SUCCESS;
00478 }
00479 
00480 /* ********************************************************************* */
00481 /* 
00482  * Polling routine for events. Returns TRUE if event
00483  * is available. If test equals TRUE, don't return. The test
00484  * flag is used to time the polling.
00485  */
00486 INT poll_event(INT source, INT count, BOOL test)
00487 {
00488     INT retval = false;
00489 
00490     if(!test) {
00491       count = 1;
00492     }
00493 
00494     for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
00495         frontend_loop();
00496         if(event_avail) {
00497           retval = true;
00498         }
00499     }
00500 
00501     return retval;
00502 }
00503 
00504 /* ********************************************************************* */
00505 INT interrupt_configure(INT cmd, INT source, PTYPE adr)
00506 {
00507     switch (cmd) {
00508     case CMD_INTERRUPT_ENABLE:
00509         interrupts_enabled = TRUE;
00510         break;
00511     case CMD_INTERRUPT_DISABLE:
00512         interrupts_enabled = FALSE;
00513         break;
00514     case CMD_INTERRUPT_ATTACH:
00515         interrupt_handler = (void (*)(void)) adr;
00516         break;
00517     case CMD_INTERRUPT_DETACH:
00518         interrupts_enabled = FALSE;
00519         interrupt_handler = NULL;
00520         break;
00521     }
00522     return SUCCESS;
00523 }
00524 
00525 /* ********************************************************************* */
00526 void print_diag_output(char *pevent)
00527 {
00528   printf("--------\n"); 
00529 
00530   printf("Event number: %d\n", (((EVENT_HEADER *)pevent)-1)->serial_number);
00531 
00532   BANK32 *pbk = NULL; 
00533   do {
00534     DWORD *pdata; 
00535     int size = bk_iterate32(pevent, &pbk, &pdata);
00536     if(pbk != NULL) {
00537       printf("%c%c%c%c\t%d\t\t", pbk->name[0], pbk->name[1], pbk->name[2],
00538         pbk->name[3], size);
00539       for(int i = 0; i < MIN(4, size/4); i++) {
00540          printf("0x%08x ", pdata[i]); 
00541       }
00542       printf("\n");
00543     }
00544   } while(pbk != NULL);
00545 
00546   printf("--------\n"); 
00547 }

00549 /* ********************************************************************* */
00550 INT read_trigger_event(char *pevent, INT off)
00551 {
00552   diag_print(2, "Event has ended.  Executing read_trigger_event.\n");
00553 
00554   // Remember that we have read out this event
00555   event_avail = false;
00556 
00557   // Initialize the event
00558   bk_init32(pevent);
00559 
00560   // Protection against readout after run has ended.
00561   if (run_state != STATE_RUNNING) {
00562     diag_print(1, "Readout after end of run!!!\n");
00563     return bk_size(pevent);
00564   }
00565 
00566   struct timeval readout_start_time;
00567   gettimeofday(&readout_start_time, NULL);
00568   // Ask trigger_modules to read out
00569   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00570      if((*trigger_modules[i]).read != NULL) {
00571        int status = (*trigger_modules[i]).read(pevent);
00572        if(status != SUCCESS) {
00573          return status;
00574        }
00575     }
00576   }
00577   gettimeofday(&readout_finished_time, NULL);
00578   diag_print(2, "Spent %f microseconds for readout.\n", 
00579     (readout_finished_time.tv_sec-readout_start_time.tv_sec)*1e6 +
00580       (readout_finished_time.tv_usec-readout_start_time.tv_usec));
00581 
00582   // Consider starting up the next block
00583   consider_start();
00584 
00585   // Print a diagnostic
00586   if(diag_print_threshold >= 2) {
00587     print_diag_output(pevent);
00588   }
00589 
00590   return bk_size(pevent);
00591 }
00592 
00593 /* ********************************************************************* */
00594 INT read_periodic_event(char *pevent, INT off)
00595 {
00596   diag_print(2, "Periodic event readout:\n");
00597 
00598   // Initialize the event
00599   bk_init32(pevent);
00600 
00601   // Ask periodic_modules to read out
00602   for(int i = 0; i < num_periodic_modules; i++) {
00603      if((*periodic_modules[i]).read != NULL) {
00604        int status = (*periodic_modules[i]).read(pevent);
00605        if(status != SUCCESS) {
00606          return status;
00607        }
00608     }
00609   }
00610 
00611   // Print a diagnostic
00612   if(diag_print_threshold >= 2) {
00613     print_diag_output(pevent);
00614   }
00615 
00616 
00617   return bk_size(pevent);
00618 }
